name: Public Cloud Business Unit
description: SEC-reportable segment. Service-centric, capital-light model providing managed services, elastic engineering, and professional services for customer environments on AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud. FY2024 revenue ~$1.68B with bookings growing 22% YoY. Q3 2025 revenue turned positive at +1% YoY — the first growth quarter after multi-year decline. FY2025 priorities: sustain 20%+ bookings growth; achieve positive revenue growth in all four quarters; grow data and AI services to 15%+ of ACV; execute 500+ customer workload migrations via Migration Factory; maintain AWS Premier Partner tier in all regions and Azure Expert MSP designation (ctr-029). Led by D K Sinha (President, appointed Jul 2022). SVP Services & Delivery: Phani Kishore Burre (appointed Nov 2025). Source: 10-K FY2024, Q4 2024 and Q3 2025 earnings calls, rackspace.com/newsroom.

name: Private Cloud Business Unit
description: SEC-reportable segment. Technology-forward, capital-intensive model providing managed services for customer environments in Rackspace data centers, customer DCs, or third-party facilities. FY2024 revenue ~$1.05B (-13% YoY) with H2 2024 bookings growing 42% vs H1 — signaling a demand inflection after years of decline. Q3 2025 revenue -3% YoY; Q4 2025 guidance flat sequential, tracking toward the guided flat H2 2025 revenue trajectory. FY2025 priorities: achieve flat revenue YoY in H2 2025; win 250+ net new logos in healthcare and public sector verticals; close 5+ sovereign and custom cloud contracts in regulated markets; complete VMware Broadcom ELA transition by Q2. Brian Lillie (President) departed Jan 2025; CEO assumed interim leadership; Lance Weaver serves as CPTO. Source: 10-K FY2024, Q4 2024 and Q3 2025 earnings calls, rackspace.com/newsroom Jan 2025.

name: Office of the Chief Executive Officer
description: Executive leadership and corporate strategy. Gajen Kandiah appointed CEO effective Sep 3, 2025, succeeding Amar Maletira. Maletira transitioned to non-employee Vice Chairman through Sep 30, 2025. Kandiah also elected to Board of Directors. Strategic priorities: AI-first multicloud strategy, platform innovation, partnership deepening, operational execution. Source: 8-K Sep 2, 2025; ir.rackspace.com CEO appointment; rackspace.com/about/leadership.

name: Finance Organization
description: Corporate finance, accounting, treasury, tax, financial planning and analysis, investor relations. Led by CFO Mark Marino (per rackspace.com/about/leadership as of research date). Previously Joseph J. Crivelli served as VP of Investor Relations (per SEC insider filings). Mark A. Marino previously served as VP & Chief Accounting Officer before promotion to CFO. Source: rackspace.com/about/leadership, SEC insider filings, wallmine.com executive data.

name: Legal Organization
description: Corporate legal, contracts, intellectual property, M&A legal, corporate secretary, ethics and compliance. Led by Chief Legal Officer Michael Bross (per rackspace.com/about/leadership). Previously Holly B. Windham served as EVP, Chief Legal Officer, Chief Ethics & Compliance Officer, Secretary, and Chief People Officer (combined role per SEC insider filings). Corporate Secretary function sends communications to c/o Corporate Secretary, 1 Fanatical Place, City of Windcrest, San Antonio, TX 78218. Source: rackspace.com/about/leadership, 2022 proxy statement, SEC insider filings.

name: Human Resources Organization
description: Talent acquisition, employee relations, total rewards, workforce planning, learning and development, culture programs. Led by CHRO Kellie Teal-Guess (per rackspace.com/about/leadership). Previously HR function was combined with Legal under Holly Windham (Chief Legal & People Officer). Separation into distinct CHRO role indicates organizational maturation. Source: rackspace.com/about/leadership, comparably.com executive team data.

name: Marketing Organization
description: Brand strategy, demand generation, content marketing, digital marketing, events, analyst relations, communications. Led by CMO Kathleen Schneider (per rackspace.com/about/leadership as of research date). Previous CMOs include Casey Shilling and Mark Bunting (per Comparably). Zarina Lam Stanford previously served as Chief Communications & Marketing Officer (per SEC insider filings). Source: rackspace.com/about/leadership, SEC insider filings.

name: AI, Technology & Sustainability Organization
description: Technical strategy, product strategy, thought leadership, IT, security, sustainability, and FAIR oversight. Led by Srini Koushik, President AI, Technology and Sustainability (also retains CTO responsibilities). Koushik has held CTO role since 2021. Bloomberg lists title as EVP/President: AI, Technology & Sustainability. Encompasses technology roadmap, information technology operations, information security, and sustainability programs. Source: rackspace.com/about/leadership/srini-koushik, Bloomberg profile, globenewswire Jun 2023 FAIR announcement.

name: Global Operations Organization
description: Global technical support delivery and operations. Led by COO Greg Hrncir. Hrncir joined Rackspace in 2000 and has held roles across technical support, data center operations, service delivery, cloud operations, and engineering. Previously served as SVP of Global Technical Support before becoming COO. Source: rackspace.com/about/leadership/greg-hrncir, comparably.com, zoominfo.com.

name: Commercial Organization
description: Strategic and alliance partner relationships, customer success, and commercial strategy. Neil Emerson serves as Chief Commercial Officer. 400+ quota-bearing sales representatives and customer success managers per 10-K FY2024. Elevated customer churn in the managed cloud segment has been disclosed as a risk factor in FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024 10-K filings. FY2025 priorities: reduce managed cloud gross churn below 12% annualized; hire VP Customer Success and build CSM function to 80 headcount; deploy Gainsight health scoring to 100% of enterprise accounts by Q2; improve NPS by 15+ points from FY2024 baseline; generate $25M+ net expansion ARR through structured TAM-driven upsell plays. Seattle Children's Hospital 10-year MSA (ctr-017) is a reference flagship outcome of this approach. Source: Comparably, Bloomberg profile, 10-K FY2022-FY2024, Gainsight partnership page.

name: Rackspace Government Solutions
description: Specialized division for federal, state, local, and education (SLED) customers. FedRAMP JAB-authorized since 2015; 23 FedRAMP authorizations. DoD SRG IL2/IL4, DFARS/CMMC, FISMA, IRS Pub 1075, HIPAA, and TAC 202 compliance. Serves more than half of Federal Government cabinet agencies. Contract vehicles include SEWP V (ctr-027) and GSA MAS (ctr-026). Partners with SMPL-C for CMMC compliance (Aug 2025). FY2025 priorities: grow federal managed cloud ARR 20%+ YoY; achieve DoD IL4 JAB authorization for at least one service offering; win 3+ new agency task orders under SEWP V; complete CMMC Level 2 certification; expand Reston Federal Office (site-002) cleared workforce to 150 personnel. Rick Rosenburg serves as VP & GM. Operates from Reston, VA (site-002). Source: rackspace.com/industry/government, FedRAMP marketplace, 10-K FY2024, globenewswire Aug 2025 SMPL-C partnership.

name: FAIR - Foundry for AI by Rackspace
description: AI practice and innovation unit for accelerating secure, responsible, sustainable AI adoption. Launched Jun 2023 with Srini Koushik as global head. Operates at startup speed within Rackspace. Service model: FAIR Ideate, FAIR Incubate, FAIR Industrialize. Has executed 70+ enterprise AI implementations. Palantir partnership (ctr-018) extends delivery to Foundry and AIP in production with 30 engineers scaling to 250+. FY2025 priorities: scale to $50M+ AI services ARR; achieve 50+ AIDE production enterprise deployments; reach 100+ active FAIR implementations; close 200+ Microsoft Copilot Services engagements; achieve Palantir AIP Gold delivery partner status. Platform support across AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom Jun 2023 FAIR announcement, fair.rackspace.com, Q4 2024 earnings call, Palantir partnership press release.

name: Americas Region
description: Regional operations covering North America and Latin America. Subroto Mukerji listed as President, Americas Region (per Comparably). Stephen A. Mills previously served as SVP & GM, Americas (per SEC insider filings). Majority of revenue generated from US customers per 10-K. 400+ quota-bearing sales reps. Offices in San Antonio (HQ), Austin, Reston, Toronto, Mexico City. Source: Comparably executive team, SEC insider filings, 10-K FY2024.

name: EMEA Region
description: Regional operations covering Europe, Middle East, and Africa. Martin H. Blackburn serves as Managing Director, EMEA (per Comparably, SEC insider filings). Rackspace Limited (Co# 03897010) registered in UK. Offices in London (Hayes), Hamburg, Zurich, Dubai. Data centers in UK (LON3, LON5) and EU (AMS1, FRA1). UK is second-largest revenue contributor. Source: Comparably, SEC insider filings, Companies House UK, rackspace.com/contact.

name: Asia Pacific & Japan Region
description: Regional operations covering Asia Pacific and Japan. Sandeep Bhargava serves as Managing Director, Asia Pacific and Japan (per Comparably, SEC insider filings). Offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Singapore, Hong Kong. Delivery centers in Gurgaon, Hyderabad, Bangalore (India), Petaling Jaya (Malaysia), Ho Chi Minh City (Vietnam), Alexandria (Egypt). Data centers in Sydney (SYD2) and Hong Kong (HKG1). Source: Comparably, SEC insider filings, rackspace.com/contact.

name: Board of Directors
description: Governing body of Rackspace Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: RXT). As of research date, 9 members: Jeffrey Benjamin (Chairman, appointed Jan 15, 2025), Betsy Atkins, Mitch Garber, Mark Gross, Gajen Kandiah (CEO/Director), Anthony Roberts, Tony Scott, Aaron Sobel, and Vikram Mahidhar. David Sambur (Apollo) stepped down Jan 2025 after 9 years. Susan Arthur departed. Thomas Cole passed away late 2023. Source: ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors.

name: Audit Committee
description: Board committee overseeing financial reporting quality, legal/regulatory compliance, independent auditor appointment/oversight (KPMG LLP), internal financial controls, and financial risk management. Chaired by Jeffrey Benjamin. Members: Mark Gross, Tony Scott. Operates under written charter. Source: ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors, ir.rackspace.com committee composition page, 2022 proxy statement.

name: Compensation Committee
description: Board committee overseeing executive compensation programs, equity awards, and compensation-related risk management. Chaired by Mitch Garber. Members: Jeffrey Benjamin, Aaron Sobel. Operates under written charter. Has delegated authority to CEO for stock-based compensation awards within prescribed limits to non-Section 16 officers. Source: ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors, 2022 proxy statement.

name: Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee
description: Board committee responsible for director nominations, corporate governance practices, and board composition evaluation. Chaired by Aaron Sobel. Members: Jeffrey Benjamin, Mitch Garber. Operates under written charter. Solicits board candidate recommendations from multiple sources. Source: ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors, 2022 proxy statement.

name: Executive Committee
description: Board committee for expedited decision-making between full board meetings. Chaired by Jeffrey Benjamin. Members: Gajen Kandiah (CEO), Aaron Sobel. Operates under written charter. Source: ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/board-of-directors, ir.rackspace.com/corporate-governance/committee-composition.

name: Consulting & Advisory Services
description: Strategic consulting practice providing multicloud strategy, data modernization advisory, and cloud security consulting. Appears as distinct engagement model across Cloud, Applications, Data, and Security solution areas on rackspace.com navigation. Referenced in rackspace.com site footer as primary engagement category alongside Professional Services and Managed Services. Source: rackspace.com site navigation and footer structure, rackspace.com/services/cloud-consulting.

name: Professional Services
description: Project-based delivery practice providing cloud adoption and migration, cloud native enablement, and application modernization services. Appears as distinct engagement model on rackspace.com alongside Consulting & Advisory and Managed Services. Delivers scoped implementations and transformations. Source: rackspace.com/services/professional-services, rackspace.com site navigation structure.

name: Managed Services
description: Ongoing managed operations practice providing cloud management and operations, SaaS lifecycle management, and data management services. Core revenue-generating engagement model. Includes Rackspace Managed Cloud (RMC) launched Oct 2023 for unified management across AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Rackspace Private Cloud, and on-premises. Source: rackspace.com/services/managed-services, globenewswire Oct 2023 RMC launch.

name: Elastic Engineering Practice
description: Dedicated pod-based engineering service model providing on-demand access to cloud expertise. Operates across hyperscaler (AWS/Azure/GCP), VMware, security, and government domains. Distinct from traditional managed services and professional services — provides continuous engineering rather than scoped projects or ticket-based support. Includes Elastic Engineering for Government variant (launched May 2022). Source: rackspace.com/cloud/elastic-engineering, rackspace.com/newsroom May 2022 EE for Government.

name: Cloud Solutions
description: Solution domain encompassing cloud adoption and migration, cloud management and operations, cloud optimization, multicloud, public cloud, private cloud, and hybrid cloud services. Top-level solution category on rackspace.com. Spans both Public Cloud and Private Cloud business units. Includes platform partnerships with AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, VMware, Oracle Cloud. Source: rackspace.com/cloud, rackspace.com site navigation.

name: Applications Solutions
description: Solution domain covering application modernization, cloud native development, IoT and edge, application operations, and SaaS lifecycle management. Technology coverage includes productivity (Microsoft 365), Rackspace Email, ERP (SAP, Oracle, Dynamics 365), CRM (Salesforce, Dynamics), and digital experience (Adobe Experience Manager, Sitecore). Source: rackspace.com/applications, rackspace.com site navigation.

name: Data Solutions
description: Solution domain encompassing data modernization, AI/ML, analytics and business insights, data strategy and governance, and data management. Technology coverage includes databases (relational, NoSQL, DBaaS), next-gen data platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP data services, Snowflake), analytics platforms, data lakes, data warehouses, and big data. Source: rackspace.com/data-solutions, rackspace.com site navigation.

name: Cyber Security & Resilience Solutions
description: Solution domain covering security strategy, cyber recovery services, elastic engineering for security, detection and response, cloud native security, application security, zero trust, network security, and data protection. Includes Cyber Recovery Cloud powered by Rubrik. Rackspace is sole provider of FedRAMP JAB-authorized managed security service. Source: rackspace.com/security, rackspace.com site navigation, rackspace.com/security/cyber-recovery-services.

name: Rackspace Technology, Inc.
description: Parent holding company. Incorporated in Delaware. Listed on NASDAQ as RXT. Headquarters: San Antonio, TX. FY2024 revenue $2.74B. Serves 81,000+ customers across 120 countries. Source: 10-K FY2024, SEC filings.

name: Rackspace US, Inc.
description: Primary US operating subsidiary. Press releases and SEC filings are issued under 'Rackspace US, Inc.' as the source entity (e.g., all GlobeNewswire releases cite 'Source: Rackspace US, Inc.'). Marks are registered service marks of Rackspace US, Inc. in the United States and other countries. Source: GlobeNewswire press release metadata, rackspace.com copyright notices.

name: Rackspace Limited
description: UK operating subsidiary. Companies House registration number 03897010. Registered address at Hayes office (site-004). Supports UK Sovereign Services and EMEA regional operations. Source: Companies House UK, L00-site.json (site-004 description).

name: Rackspace International GmbH
description: European operating entity. Srini Koushik has employment history with Rackspace International GmbH per RocketReach. Swiss entity supporting European operations. Zurich office (site-015) serves as corporate office. Source: RocketReach executive data, rackspace.com/contact (Zurich office listing).

name: Financial Services Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving financial services customers including banking, insurance, and capital markets. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/financial-services. Lata Varghese (SVP Business Transformation) brings specific financial services domain expertise (digital banking, payments, blockchain). Source: rackspace.com/industry/financial-services, globenewswire Nov 2025 Varghese appointment.

name: Healthcare Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving healthcare organizations. Frost & Sullivan recognized Rackspace in 2024 Frost Radar for Healthcare Enterprise Cloud Managed Services. AdventHealth partnership delivered one of largest third-party Epic cloud deployments covering 53 hospitals across 9 states. HIPAA compliance supported. Source: rackspace.com/industry/healthcare, rackspace.com/resources Frost Radar 2024, rackspace.com/newsroom AdventHealth case.

name: Manufacturing Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving manufacturing organizations with cloud, data, and AI solutions. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/manufacturing. Source: rackspace.com/industry/manufacturing.

name: SaaS & ISV Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving SaaS companies and independent software vendors with cloud platform optimization, scaling, and managed services. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/saas-isv. Source: rackspace.com/industry/saas-isv.

name: Retail Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving retail organizations. Total Wine & More partnership announced Oct 2025 for performance optimization and innovation. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/retail. Source: rackspace.com/industry/retail, globenewswire Oct 2025 Total Wine announcement.

name: Education Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving education organizations with cloud solutions and compliance support. Rackspace Government Solutions provides FedRAMP-authorized services at federal, state, local, and education levels. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/education. Source: rackspace.com/industry/education, rackspace.com/industry/government (SLED coverage).

name: Private Equity Practice
description: Specialized practice serving private equity firms evaluating and optimizing portfolio companies. Apollo Global Management is a significant shareholder (PE sponsor from 2016 LBO). Vikram Mahidhar (Board member) is Operating Partner at Apollo Portfolio Performance Solutions. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/partners/private-equity. Source: rackspace.com/partners/private-equity, ir.rackspace.com board bios.

name: Strategic Alliances & Partnerships
description: Partner ecosystem management including hyperscaler partnerships (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), technology partnerships (VMware, Dell Technologies, Oracle, NVIDIA), and channel partner program. 3,800+ AWS accreditations, 15 AWS competencies, 15 AWS service validations per 10-K. Global Partner Program at rackspace.com/about/channel-partners. Dell Technologies alliance recognized with Two Global Alliances Partner of the Year Awards for 2025. Source: rackspace.com/about/strategic-alliances, rackspace.com/about/channel-partners, 10-K FY2024, rackspace.com/newsroom Dell awards 2025.

name: Global Partner Program
description: Channel partner program extending Rackspace direct sales force through ecosystem of partners. 10-K states company employs ecosystem of partners that extend the direct sales force and provide additional business opportunities. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/about/channel-partners. Source: 10-K FY2024, rackspace.com/about/channel-partners.

name: Data Center Operations
description: Management and operations of Rackspace-owned and operated data center facilities globally. Dedicated about page at rackspace.com/about/data-centers. Facilities across US (DFW, IAD, SJC, ORD, MCI, NYC, SFO), UK (LON), EU (AMS, FRA), APAC (SYD, HKG). Infrastructure for colocation, managed hosting, private cloud, and government cloud workloads. Source: rackspace.com/about/data-centers, L00-site.json data center entities.

name: Global Delivery Centers
description: Offshore and nearshore delivery centers providing technical support, engineering, and managed services delivery. Locations include India (Gurgaon site-009, Hyderabad site-010, Bangalore site-011), Malaysia (Petaling Jaya site-016), Egypt (Alexandria site-017), Vietnam (Ho Chi Minh City site-018), and Mexico (Mexico City site-014). Source: L00-site.json delivery center entities, rackspace.com/contact.

name: Rackspace Fabric Platform
description: Platform unit providing unified governance, ticketing, billing, tagging, and management across entire IT estate. Referenced as Rackspace Fabric™ across all solution engagement models (Consulting, Professional Services, Managed Services). Dedicated page at rackspace.com/services/rackspace-fabric. Trademarked offering. Source: rackspace.com/services/rackspace-fabric, rackspace.com site navigation.

name: Rackspace Spot
description: Cloud infrastructure auctioned in open market, delivered as turnkey fully managed Kubernetes clusters. Operates on separate domain (spot.rackspace.com). Distinct operating model from traditional managed services — open market auction pricing. Source: rackspace.com/cloud (Rackspace Spot listing), spot.rackspace.com.

name: Sales Organization
description: Direct sales force of 400+ quota-bearing representatives and customer success managers per 10-K FY2024. Thomas Wolf previously served as SVP of Global Sales Strategy & Operations (per SEC insider filings). Matthew M. Stoyka previously served as Chief Solutions Officer. Supported by partner ecosystem extending direct sales reach. Source: 10-K FY2024, SEC insider filings (wallmine.com).

name: Investor Relations
description: Investor communications, financial analyst engagement, SEC filing coordination, and shareholder services. Joseph J. Crivelli previously served as VP of Investor Relations (per SEC insider filings). Dedicated website at ir.rackspace.com. Contact: investorrelations@rackspace.com. Source: ir.rackspace.com, SEC insider filings.

name: OpenStack & Kubernetes Business Unit
description: Global organization within Private Cloud providing end-to-end customer experience, operations, product management, and engineering for OpenStack and Kubernetes product portfolio. Led by Josh Villarreal, General Manager. Products include OpenStack Flex, OpenStack Business, OpenStack Enterprise (launched Aug 2024), and managed Kubernetes services. Source: rackspace.com/article-author/josh-villarreal, ir.rackspace.com OpenStack Enterprise announcement, itprotoday.com Aug 2024 interview.

name: DACH Region
description: Sub-regional operations covering Germany, Austria, and Switzerland (DACH). Jürgen Stauber serves as General Manager, DACH (appointed Feb 2020, previously DXC Technology Director Industries). Highlighted as strategic growth market. Bright Skies GmbH acquisition (Nov 2020) more than doubled professional services headcount in Germany. Offices in Hamburg (site-005) and Zurich (site-015). Source: rackspace.com/newsroom Feb 2020 Stauber appointment, pressebox.com Bright Skies acquisition Nov 2020.

name: Bright Skies GmbH
description: Acquired subsidiary (Nov 2020). Leading cloud transformation provider in Germany specializing in data center modernization, cloud transformation, modern workforce, data and AI. Gold-certified Microsoft Partner with 16 Microsoft competencies (14 gold). 55+ employees at acquisition across Hamburg, Cologne, Dresden, Mannheim. ~500 customers including Dole, HSV, DOMCURA. Kim Nis Neuhauss (founder/CEO) became Chief Sales Officer DACH and Deputy GM DACH post-acquisition. Deferred transaction consideration payments continued through FY2024 per SEC filings. Source: rackspace.com/bright-skies, pressebox.com Nov 2020, sec.gov SEC comment letter 2024.

name: Just Analytics Pte Ltd
description: Acquired subsidiary (Jan 18, 2022). Singapore-headquartered cloud-based data, analytics and AI company. Acquisition completed as reported in 10-K FY2024 XBRL data. Deferred acquisition-related payments requiring continued employment treated as post-combination compensation expense through FY2024. Source: wikipedia.org Rackspace acquisitions, sec.gov 10-K XBRL JustAnalyticsPteLtdMember, sec.gov SEC comment letter 2024.

name: Rackspace Government Solutions, Inc.
description: Separate legal entity incorporated in Delaware for government services. Identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Provides FedRAMP-authorized cloud services to federal, state, local, and education customers. Distinct from operating unit 'Rackspace Government Solutions' (ou-011) which represents the business operations. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Hosting Australia Pty Ltd
description: Australian operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Supports APAC regional operations from Sydney (site-006) and Melbourne (site-007) offices. Data center in Sydney (SYD2, site-047). Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace India Private Limited
description: Indian operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Operates delivery centers in Gurgaon (site-009), Hyderabad (site-010), and Bangalore (site-011). Major offshore delivery hub. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Datapipe, Inc.
description: Acquired subsidiary (Sep 2017). Enterprise managed services and cloud company. Retained as distinct legal entity post-acquisition per Exhibit 21.1. Multiple international sub-entities: Datapipe Asia Limited (Hong Kong), Datapipe Europe Limited (UK), Datapipe Germany GmbH, Datapipe Israel Limited, Datapipe Singapore Pte Ltd. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, wikipedia.org Rackspace acquisitions.

name: Onica Group LLC
description: Acquired subsidiary (Nov 2019). AWS Premier Consulting Partner specializing in cloud-native professional services, DevOps, and managed cloud services. Retained as legal entity post-acquisition per Exhibit 21.1. Sub-entities: Onica Egypt LLC (site-017 Alexandria delivery center), Onica Holdings LLC, Onica Technologies Canada Inc. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, wikipedia.org Rackspace acquisitions.

name: Rackspace Asia Limited
description: Hong Kong operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Supports APAC operations. Hong Kong data center (HKG1, site-051). Rackspace Asia (Shanghai) Limited is a related Chinese entity. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Canada, Inc.
description: Canadian operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Toronto office (site-013). Onica Technologies Canada, Inc. is a related entity from the Onica acquisition. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Mexico s.de R.L. de C.V.
description: Mexican operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Mexico City office (site-014). Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Singapore Pte Ltd
description: Singapore operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Singapore office (site-008). Datapipe Singapore Pte Ltd is a related entity from the Datapipe acquisition. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Professional Services Japan GK
description: Japanese professional services entity identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Godo Kaisha (GK) structure for Japan market professional services delivery. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Benelux BV
description: Netherlands operating subsidiary identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. GoGrid AMS B.V. is a related Dutch entity. Amsterdam data center (AMS1). Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Cloud Office, LLC
description: Legal entity for Rackspace Email and email/productivity hosting services identified in Exhibit 21.1 of S-1 filing. Operates Rackspace Email, Microsoft Exchange hosting, and Microsoft 365 management services. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, rackspace.com/applications/email-productivity.

name: Information Security Organization
description: Enterprise information security function headed by a Chief Security Officer (CSO) who reports to the President - AI, Technology and Sustainability (Srini Koushik). CSO has 20+ years of experience in information security leadership with large technology, healthcare, and financial institutions; holds BS from Arizona State University; with Rackspace since 2019. Provides quarterly updates to Audit Committee. Cross-functional group of security, risk, and compliance personnel meets regularly. Encompasses CSOC (Customer Security Operations Center) and ISOC (Internal Security Operations Center). Source: 10-K FY2023 Item 1C Cybersecurity, board-cybersecurity.com 10-K disclosure analysis.

name: Cyber Defense Center
description: Global Security Operations Center providing 24x7x365 customer-facing and internal security monitoring, threat detection, incident response, and vulnerability management. Formerly referred to as Customer Security Operations Center (CSOC) and Internal Security Operations Center (ISOC). GCIH-certified incident handlers. Delivers Rackspace Managed XDR services. GIAC-certified security analysts. Source: rackspace.com/security/on-premises-security, rackspace.com/security/threat-detection, blog.rackspace.com Oct 2018 Galligan profile, rackspace.com/case-studies/toi-toi-dixi.

name: Government Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving government organizations at federal, state, local, and education levels. Distinct from Rackspace Government Solutions (ou-011) which is the specialized division. This practice covers go-to-market, solution packaging, and industry-specific consulting. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/industry/government. Source: rackspace.com/industry/government.

name: Non-Profit Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving non-profit organizations with cloud solutions. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/non-profit. Source: rackspace.com/industry/non-profit.

name: Consumer Goods Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving consumer goods companies. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/consumer-goods. Source: rackspace.com/industry/consumer-goods.

name: Oil & Gas Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving oil and gas companies with cloud, data, and AI solutions. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/oil-and-gas. Source: rackspace.com/industry/oil-and-gas.

name: Media & Entertainment Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving media and entertainment companies. BMG partnership (Google Cloud migration) is a notable engagement managed through DACH region. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/media-entertainment. Source: rackspace.com/industry/media-entertainment, rackspace.com/newsroom BMG case study.

name: Automotive & Transportation Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving automotive and transportation companies. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/automotive-transportation. Source: rackspace.com/industry/automotive-transportation.

name: Food & Beverage Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving food and beverage companies. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/food-beverage. Source: rackspace.com/industry/food-beverage.

name: Travel & Hospitality Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving travel and hospitality companies. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/travel-hospitality. Source: rackspace.com/industry/travel-hospitality.

name: Public Utilities Industry Practice
description: Industry vertical serving public utility companies. Dedicated practice page at rackspace.com/industry/public-utilities. Source: rackspace.com/industry/public-utilities.

name: AWS Practice
description: Hyperscaler platform practice for Amazon Web Services. ISG Provider Lens Leader for AWS Partners Ecosystem 2024 and 2025. 3,800+ AWS accreditations, 15 AWS competencies, 15 AWS service validations per 10-K FY2024. AWS Premier Consulting Partner. Onica acquisition (2019) brought deep AWS-native professional services capability. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/cloud/aws. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/aws, 10-K FY2024, rackspace.com homepage ISG recognition.

name: Microsoft Azure Practice
description: Hyperscaler platform practice for Microsoft Azure. ISG Provider Lens Leader for Microsoft Partner Ecosystem 2025. Bright Skies acquisition (2020) brought Gold-certified Microsoft competencies. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/cloud/azure. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/azure, rackspace.com homepage ISG recognition.

name: Google Cloud Practice
description: Hyperscaler platform practice for Google Cloud. ISG Provider Lens Leader for Google Cloud Partner Ecosystem 2025. Notable engagements include BMG music platform migration. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/cloud/google-cloud. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/google-cloud, rackspace.com homepage ISG recognition.

name: VMware Practice
description: Platform practice for VMware technologies. VMware Cloud Service Provider Pinnacle partner (highest partner tier). Delivers fully managed VMware Cloud Foundation solutions. Rackspace Services for VMware is a distinct service offering. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/cloud/vmware. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/vmware, rackspace.com/security (VMware reference).

name: Rackspace Technology Global, Inc.
description: Operating subsidiary. Formerly known as Rackspace Hosting, Inc. (the original pre-LBO public company). Name changed post-Apollo acquisition. Identified in Exhibit 21.1 as Delaware corporation. Historical entity from original IPO era (pre-2016). Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Email & Productivity Services
description: Operating unit providing hosted email and collaboration services including Rackspace Email, Microsoft Exchange hosting, Microsoft 365 management, and Microsoft SharePoint hosting. Separate customer portal (Cloud Office Control Panel). Dedicated pages at rackspace.com/applications/rackspace-email, rackspace.com/applications/microsoft-exchange, rackspace.com/applications/office-365, rackspace.com/applications/sharepoint. Source: rackspace.com/applications (email-productivity section), rackspace.com login page (Cloud Office Control Panel).

name: Colocation Services
description: Operating unit providing colocation hosting services in Rackspace data centers. Customers lease rack space, power, and connectivity within Rackspace facilities. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/cloud/colocation. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/colocation.

name: UK Sovereign Cloud Services
description: UK-focused sovereign cloud operations supporting PSN (Public Services Network), Cyber Essentials Plus, and UK government requirements. Rackspace Limited holds PSN compliance certification per existing validated data. London data centers (LON3 site-035, LON5 site-036) provide UK sovereign data residency. Source: 10-K FY2023 Item 1C cybersecurity disclosure (PSN/Cyber Essentials mentioned), L00-site.json UK data center entities.

name: Onica Egypt LLC
description: Egyptian entity from Onica acquisition. Alexandria delivery center (site-017) is associated with Onica Egypt operations. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, L00-site.json site-017.

name: Onica Technologies Canada, Inc.
description: Canadian entity from Onica acquisition. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Tricore Solutions, LLC
description: SAP and ERP managed services provider. Acquired May 2017. Specializes in SAP hosting, managed services for ERP applications. Massachusetts LLC. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, wikipedia.org Rackspace acquisitions.

name: Tricore Solutions Private Limited
description: Indian subsidiary of TriCore Solutions. Delivery center supporting SAP/ERP managed services. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Tricore DBS, LLC
description: Delaware subsidiary of TriCore Solutions. DBS likely refers to Database Services. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: ObjectRocket, LLC
description: Managed database-as-a-service (DBaaS) platform. Delaware LLC. Acquired by Rackspace pre-2017. Provides managed MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis, PostgreSQL, and MySQL services. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/data/objectrocket-dbaas. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, rackspace.com/data/objectrocket-dbaas, wikipedia.org Rackspace acquisitions.

name: RelationEdge, LLC
description: Salesforce consulting and CRM services provider. Delaware LLC. Acquired Sep 2018. Specializes in Salesforce implementation, integration, and managed services. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, wikipedia.org Rackspace acquisitions, rackspace.com/applications/salesforce.

name: Database Specialists, LLC
description: California LLC specializing in database management services. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace International Mobility GmbH
description: Swiss entity for international employee mobility and assignment management. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace New Zealand Limited
description: New Zealand operating subsidiary. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Cloud Academy, LLC
description: Boot camp-style technical training entity. Formerly Open Cloud Academy, LLC (fka noted in Exhibit 21.1). Provides network administration and cybersecurity skills training. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, crunchbase.com Rackspace Cloud Academy.

name: Rackspace Germany GmbH
description: German operating subsidiary. Hamburg office (site-005). Distinct from Datapipe Germany GmbH and Bright Skies GmbH. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020.

name: Rackspace Asia (Shanghai) Limited
description: Chinese subsidiary for Shanghai operations. Data center presence in Shanghai per Wikipedia. Source: sec.gov Exhibit 21.1 S-1 2020, wikipedia.org Rackspace data center locations.

name: India Center of Excellence
description: Major delivery center operating as 100% subsidiary of Rackspace Technology with 2,200+ employees (Rackers). Regional in-country reporting structure for performance management, compensation, and career development. Certified as Great Place to Work. Operates Agile Performance practice launched 2021. Supports both public and private cloud service delivery. 52+ Learning Hours initiative via Rackspace University achieved 70% avg completion rate. Over 2,500 technical certifications held by India-based Rackers. Source: rackspace.com/blog/our-india-center-excellence-certified-best-place-work Jul 2022.

name: FinOps Practice
description: Dedicated FinOps consulting and managed services team. FinOps & Cloud certified professionals. Offers 120-Day Risk Free FinOps Engagement (listed on AWS Marketplace), FinOps Core Accelerator (4-month consultative sprint), and ongoing FinOps managed services. Provides cloud financial analysts for cost optimization, governance policy implementation, and organizational alignment across finance, technology, and business teams. Uses Ternary platform for GCP cost visibility. Source: aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/prodview-q7ldygbwub2yo, rackspace.com/cloud/cloud-optimization, rackspace.com/resources/finops-assessment, ternary.app Rackspace customer story 2024.

name: Services & Delivery Organization - Public Cloud
description: Public Cloud services and delivery function led by SVP Phani Kishore Burre (appointed Nov 2025). Responsible for execution of managed services, professional services, and elastic engineering delivery for public cloud customers across AWS, Azure, Google Cloud. Reports within the Public Cloud Business Unit under President D K Sinha. 20+ years experience supporting Fortune 100 clients across retail, healthcare, financial services, and life sciences. Source: ir.rackspace.com Rackspace appoints Lata Varghese and Phani Kishore Burre Nov 17 2025, itbrief.asia Nov 19 2025.

name: Business Transformation Organization
description: Enterprise business transformation function led by SVP Lata Varghese (appointed Nov 2025). Drives organizational transformation, operating model improvements, and execution enhancement across Rackspace. Varghese brings global P&L management experience from Cognizant and Randstad Digital, with domain expertise in financial services, digital banking, payments, blockchain, and digital assets. CEO Kandiah stated focus on 'strengthening our operating model, improving execution, and turning AI and hybrid cloud into practical outcomes'. Source: ir.rackspace.com Nov 17 2025, itbrief.asia Nov 19 2025.

name: Product & Technology Organization - Private Cloud
description: Product and technology function for Private Cloud business unit. Led by Lance Weaver as Chief Product and Technology Officer, Rackspace Private Cloud. Responsible for OpenStack Flex, OpenStack Business, OpenStack Enterprise, Rackspace Spot (GPUaaS), Rackspace AI Business platform, Kubernetes services, and colocation products. Built Gen-2 provisioning for Spot, launched SJC3 data center, and developed AI-optimized infrastructure with Dell Servers and NVIDIA GPUs. Source: globenewswire.com Rackspace GPUaaS launch Nov 4 2024, rackspace.com/newsroom OpenStack Business Jul 8 2025, rackspace.com/newsroom Rackspace AI Business Mar 25 2025.

name: Rackspace Foundation
description: Corporate philanthropic foundation focused on STEM education and community investment. Over $8M raised for education supporting 10,000+ students with STEM and holistic programs. Every Rackspace employee receives 40 hours of volunteer time off per year, delivering 23,000 hours logged and $160,000 raised for local causes in recent reporting periods. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom 2025 Sustainability Report Oct 21 2025, globenewswire.com 2025 Sustainability Report.

name: Rackspace University
description: Internal learning and development organization. Administers 52+ Learning Hours initiative with 70% average completion rate among India Rackers. Supports 13,000+ technical certifications earned since 2023 across AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Cisco, Oracle, Red Hat, SAP, VMware and others. 95% of employees achieved AI-ready certification. 1,700+ cloud engineers across Linux, Windows, and VMware. 11,000+ certifications across AWS, Microsoft, Google Cloud Platform and VMware. Source: rackspace.com/blog/india-center-excellence Jul 2022, rackspace.com/newsroom 2025 Sustainability Report Oct 21 2025.

name: Customer Success Center
description: Customer engagement and briefing center providing virtual and in-person executive briefings. Creates personalized agendas built around customer needs, expectations, and goals in coordination with Rackspace account teams. Covers cloud solutions, application solutions, data solutions, and security solutions briefings. Source: rackspace.com/about/customer-success-center.

name: Oracle Cloud Practice
description: Cloud practice delivering Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) managed services. Rackspace employees hold Oracle certifications alongside AWS, Microsoft, Google Cloud, Cisco, Red Hat, SAP, and VMware. OCI offering includes cost-savings, performance improvements, and security for cloud applications on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Dedicated page at rackspace.com/cloud/oracle. Source: rackspace.com/cloud/oracle, rackspace.com/newsroom 2025 Sustainability Report (Oracle certifications referenced).

name: Rackspace DBaaS
description: Database-as-a-Service offering providing managed database services. Includes ObjectRocket platform (MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis, PostgreSQL, MySQL) and broader managed database capabilities. Dedicated product page at rackspace.com/data/dbaas. Distinct from ObjectRocket LLC legal entity. Source: rackspace.com/data/objectrocket-dbaas, rackspace.com/data/dbaas, rackspace.com/solve article Sep 15 2025 'Rackspace DBaaS Powers Your Database Needs'.

name: Internal Data & Analytics Organization
description: Internal data modernization team that consolidated 70 data warehouses and reduced 400 dashboards to 20. Implemented sAFE (Scaled Agile Framework for Enterprises) methodology improving velocity from 91 days to 17 days. Built churn risk prediction model synthesizing account movement and opportunity data for customer success teams. Established ISO-like stamp certifying data quality, standardized data definitions and governance. Maintains PCI and GDPR compliance controls and internal retention policies in data operations. Source: rackspace.com/case-studies/rackspace-technology-0 (internal data modernization case study).

name: Sustainability & ESG Organization
description: Sustainability function within AI, Technology & Sustainability organization under Srini Koushik. Achieved SBTi validation of near-term and long-term net-zero emissions targets in 2025. Goals: 50% emissions reduction by 2032, 90% by 2045. Achieved 10% total emissions reduction 2023-2024 (20% Scope 1&2, 9% Scope 3). 80% of global DCs powered by renewable energy. RE100 member. Co-authored SustainableIT.org 'IT Toolkit for Responsible and Sustainable AI'. Formalized circular IT lifecycle asset disposal policy. Third-party audited Scope 1,2,3 emissions baseline. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom 2025 Sustainability Report Oct 21 2025, globenewswire.com 2025 Sustainability Report.

name: Managed Security Services
description: Customer-facing security services organization delivering Rackspace Managed XDR, security monitoring, vulnerability management, and compliance services. Distinct from internal Information Security Organization (CSO function). Services include managed detection and response (MDR), next-gen SOC services, strategic security services, and technical security services. ISG Provider Lens 2025 Leader in three cybersecurity categories. RAISE (Rackspace AI Security Engine) launched Aug 2025 for AI-driven threat detection within Rackspace Cyber Defense Center. Source: rackspace.com/newsroom RAISE launch Aug 20 2025, ISG Provider Lens 2025 Cybersecurity report.

name: Agentic AI & Intelligent Automation Practice
description: Specialized practice within FAIR delivering enterprise AI agent solutions. Launched FAIR MCP Enterprise Accelerator on AWS Marketplace in AI Agents & Tools category (Jul 2025). Delivers 70%+ reduction in legacy application integration for AI agents. Partnered with Sema4.ai for first scalable enterprise AI agent solution (Jun 2025). Builds multi-agent architectures with advanced reasoning, memory retention, secure code interpretation, and multimodal data processing on Amazon Bedrock. Source: ir.rackspace.com MCP Accelerator announcement Jul 17 2025, globenewswire.com Sema4.ai partnership Jun 18 2025.
